|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 810154014477 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B004IEALCQ |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "PU40VL810GC" and "MADE IN CHINA" is silkscreened on the board used to populate this entry. :This device would seem to be a [http://www.sunrichtech.com.hk/assign.asp?keyid=ba45 '''Sunrich Technology''' U-540].
This device uses a '''VIA Labs, Inc.''' ('''VLI''') Hub IC - VL811. :The chip package is marked with "VLI", "VL811-Q8", "1226 (T)", and "83C4246400". A '''Macronix''' MX25L512EMI-10G (512Kb / 64KB) serial flash accompanies the controller.
It presents itself to the host system as two 2109:0811 devices with a xHCI controller (one for USB 3.0, one for USB 2.0) and a single 2109:0811 device with a USB 2.0/1.x controller.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
